intro: Epipactis myodes, commonly known as the slender helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves and produces a spike of pale green to white flowers with a distinctive, intricate lip. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodland areas and thrives in temperate climates. Epipactis myodes is known for its ability to form dense colonies and is often found in rich, humusy soils. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects, contributing to its ecological importance in forest ecosystems.
